title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 603.5 - Contents of petition
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 603.5 - Contents of petition

State Regulations

The petition shall contain a statement of the desires of
applicant, the history of the case, and a concise statement of the facts and
arguments in favor of the contentions of applicant. It shall recite that it has
been impossible to agree as to rates, that the making of application was duly
authorized and the authority of the person signing and verifying the petition. It shall ask the commission to fix fair and reasonable charges or rates to be
paid for water, or such other relief as may be desired, and shall specify by
what authority the relief is sought--such as section 40, chapter 724, Laws of
1905, chapter 350, Laws of 1909, section 528, Conservation Law, etc., or
decision of the Water Power and Control Commission of ________
(date)

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
603.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
